randomStrings: Never spend 6 minutes doing something by hand when you can spend 6 hours failing to automate it.
Something > Nothing
Quality > Quantity
Ask a programmer to review 10 lines of code, he'll find 10 issues. Ask him to do 500 lines and he'll say it looks good.
6 hours of debugging can safe you 5 minutes of reading documentation.
Programmer: A machine that turns coffee into code.
Computers are fast; programmers keep it slow.
When I wrote this code, only God and I understood what I did. Now only God knows.
A son asked his father (a programmer) why the sun rises in the east, and sets in the west. His response? It works, don't touch!
Copy-and-Paste was programmed by programmers for programmers actually.
Software and cathedrals are much the same — first we build them, then we pray.
There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third works.
If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
Deleted code is debugged code.
It's not a bug — it's an undocumented feature.
It works on my machine.
In a room full of top software designers, if two agree on the same thing, that's a majority.
Programmer: A person who fixed a problem that you don't know you have, in a way you don't understand.
Algorithm: Word used by programmers when... they do not want to explain what they did.
What is a programmer's favourite hangout place? Foo Bar
What do computers and air conditioners have in common? They both become useless when you open windows.
Real programmers count from 0.
I use arch btw :)
Linux is better than Windows
